alphabetsoup.userinterface
Class RenderWindow

java.lang.Object
  alphabetsoup.userinterface.RenderWindow

public class RenderWindow
extends java.lang.Object

RenderWindow contains all of the code to initialize and draw the window and accept input from the user. It also contains the main loop for user interaction and rendering. This class is not necessary if an AlphabetSoup simulation is being run without graphics.

Author:
Chris Hazard

mainLoop

public static void mainLoop(SimulationWorld sw,
                            double elapsed_time)
Continually loops, processing user input and rendering the state of the simulation until finished

Parameters:
elapsed_time - time to run the simulation. if 0.0, then continually run

renderString

public static void renderString(float x,
                                float y,
                                java.lang.String msg)
Renders the specified string to the specified position

Parameters:
x - x coordinate to begin rendering (left justified)
y - y coordinate to begin rendering. text will be centered vertically on this y position
msg - string to render

setColor

public static void setColor(int c)
Sets the rendering color based on a 32-bit integer (RGBA)

Parameters:
c - 32-bit integer representing the color

renderTiledLetter

public static void renderTiledLetter(float x,
                                     float y,
                                     Letter l,
                                     boolean filled)
Renders a specified letter to the specified location

Parameters:
x - x coordinate of the tile (left justified)
y - y coordinate of the tile. text will be centered vertically on this y position
l - Letter to render
filled - if true, the tile will be rendered as filled. if false, it will be renedred as an empty tile slot

renderTiledWord

public static void renderTiledWord(float x,
                                   float y,
                                   Word w)
Renders an entire tiled Word at the specified location

Parameters:
x - x coordinate of the tile (left justified)
y - y coordinate of the tile. text will be centered vertically on this y position
w - reference to the word to render

buildFont

public static void buildFont(java.lang.String font_name,
                             int font_size,
                             float font_render_size,
                             int bitmap_size)
Builds a set of texturemaps based on the font name and size requested

Parameters:
font_name - System name of the font
font_size - Size in points
font_render_size - Specifies how big the letters should be rendered for other string and letter rendering functions
bitmap_size - resolution of each letter's texturemap
